description.narrative: IR18: Complementary basic education opportunities expanded to out-of-school children aged 8-14 years in at least 5 deprived districts, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 005 : The needs of out-of-school children aged 6-14 years, especially girls, children with special needs and OVCs are systematically assessed and addressed in disadvantaged areas in five focus regions

title.narrative: IR18: Complementary basic education opportunities expanded to out-of-school children aged 8-14 years in at least 5 depriveddistricts

description.narrative: 1,856 children (998 boys and 858 girls) enrolled in the final cycle of the 2016-17 Complementary Basic Education programme which concluded in four districts. 97.5 per cent children completed nine months of community-based classes and 93 per cent of children entered formal primary school for the 2017-18 school year. | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/12/2017
